content_scrubbed:
Note on the kid pictured (and his college).
-----

Grinnell College is a [ridiculously expensive private liberal_arts college](http://en. wikipedia. org/wiki/Grinnell_College) (in the [middle of Iowa, mind you](http://en. wikipedia. org/wiki/Grinnell,_Iowa) -- we're talking Radar O'Reilly territory -- {nothing wrong with Iowa, it[.] just that we're not talking Ivy League, Cal-Tech or MIT here, this is Podunk U}):

The 2011-12 comprehensive fee is $49,144 (**tuition & fees, $39,810;** room and board, $9,334). When determining eligibility for assistance, annual allowances are made for the following expenses: Books & Supplies $900 Personal Expenses $1,100 Travel Expenses $200-1,800 depending upon home state/country.  [Source](http://www. grinnell. edu/admission/apply/tuition).

**So $16,000 paid for only about of 1/3 of this ~~sucker[.]~~ student[.] *annual* cost.**

And that alone ($50k a year for a no-name liberal_arts college) tells me this kid is NOT a math genius (so it should NOT be surprising that he fails to understand the impact of subsidized loans on the cost of tuition).

---

EDIT: Just for S&G I googled the kid[.] name and found a bit more [on the kid himself](http://www. grinnell. edu/admission/voices/students/frerick).  First of all he[.] a Professor[.] Assistant (whatever) and ... wait for it... Political Science major (big surprise there).

How did he pick his college? What kind of cost-benefit and ROI did he do? Well... let[.] let him talk for himself:

**Why did you choose Grinnell?** Honestly, *I got this feeling* during my visit that Grinnell was the_right college. I remember turning to my mom at the end of the tour and saying "This is it." I went home that night and started on my early decision application. The financial aid was the cherry on top. 

So... see, he "got this feeling" (a woody from a passing coed? or nausea from the cafeteria? maybe just gas from a carbonated drink? Or... most likely he was impressed by the fancy new buildings and facilities). And that was enough to say: "screw the $$ let[.] go HERE".

Oh, and financial aid?  Its a "cherry on top".

Also (get this) he spent a year OFF campus (do you still have to pay tuition and room & board then?  Apparently, because [the year is part of an "Off Campus Study Program"](http://www. grinnell. edu/offices/ocs)!  Woohoo!  $50k for a "University of Phoenix" program where you can, in his words be: "crashing on the couch of some alum" -- so apparently it[.] almost like a [Gap Yah](http://www. youtube. com/watch?v=eKFjWR7X5dU)), to wit:

**What is your favorite Grinnell memory?** One of my favorite Grinnell memories did not actually occur at Grinnell. Rather, during my year off campus I was constantly traveling and exploring new places and in almost every instance I was doing it with a Grinnellian. Whether I was crashing on the couch of some alum I knew or meeting up with another Grinnellian in some foreign city, there was always a Grinnell connection. Knowing that leaving the "physical Grinnell" didn't mean that I actually left Grinnell is one of my favorite memories from this past year.
